Perceptor:

"Could be or not necesary, i dont know"replied Dryly PErceptor"That depends 
of the scan and the strategy to follow, My best bet is do the same what I 
did some weeks ago... Insolate the programs and install the other ones and 
partially unleash her memories; and speaking about her memories... If Kups 
observations are true then Her behavior could be a risk for herself and 
others; we couldnt afford sedate her again I dont know how much her health 
could stand it; If she Remembers you, you be able to calm her down enough to 
avoid any umpleasant situation cause she has strong emotional attachments 
with you and the other being that has stronger attachment is your Daughter 
and it's too young to put her in a risk... Speaking about risks, do you know 
if she still has my blaster? I gave her in one of  the Maximals invations 
and she hadnt given it back"



> <NEW>
>
> Rodimus' optics soften a bit as the discussion turns to Nightlight, "I
> will do whatever I can to help." He said cautiously. "Will you need me
> to be here for it?" He said, feeling pulled between his need to be out
> there looking at the bugs and the need to be here for Nightlight.
>
> Even as Rodimus spoke Bump was moving the still form of Nightlight
> onto one of the examination beds. Bump, for his small size was strong,
> easilly lifting the female onto the bed. He carefully placed her down
> on her back on the bed and then began to manipulate controls on the
> side of it.
>
> Twin scanners began to move across Nightlight, beepiing as they did
> so. "The initial scan has begun." Bump said as he watched the results
> from his screen, Legacy moved to stand behind him, his single optic
> watching the screen carefully as well.
>
> (TAG)
